Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I am not very confident but I do try, and ask when I'm not sure. Some medical terms I don't understand even though I've seen or heard them before.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I do have a primary care doctor, and generally I trust his advice but sometimes doubt that he is giving me all the information I need about certain situations.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I often feel worried because I don't fully understand my problems, so I can't tell if I might be getting worse, or that I might learn something negative like I might have something that can't be treated.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I found out about my thyroid problem (hypothyroidism), I did a little reading and found out that a chemical imbalance is what was the cause. And that the thyroid gland acts somewhat like an alternator on a car. It secrets hormones to various parts of the body to maintain a stable metabolism.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I do not have a primary care doctor. I rarely see a doctor. In my experience doctors always have bad news so I really don't have much trust in them. When my husband was sick there were a few doctors that were honest and thoughtful but the majority of them seemed disinterested and made the wrong decisions because they did not take the time to get updated on his condition.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I fear what the doctor might tell me. I will worry from the day I make the appointment until I finish the visit. If I were dying, I don't think I would want to know. Doctors don't seem to understand this fear.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My husband had a sudden cardiac arrest and was unconcious for 14 days and in the intensive care for 30 days. I was the one responsible for making decisions for him. I was very attentive and asked many questions during rounds. If there was anything I had a question about, I would question the doctor. I understood fully what the nurses and doctors told me.

I believe that I have the mental and physical capacity to obtain, process, and understand the information and services for health decisions. However, emotionally, I often feel that I don't have the capacity, as I am often stressed when visiting a doctor's office and either forget questions or feel ashamed to ask them. Financially I also avoid going to the doctor's, so when I do go it is usually for something unrelated to the questions I have been having in my day-to-day life.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor because she shows genuine concern and often discusses options with me in regards to my treatment. I am only neutral on some issues because I feel that she is very busy, and often is trying to get through things quickly, or discredits certain things I report as "just my anxiety" since I have a medical history with it.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I worry that anything I bring up in regards to my health will not be paid attention to because of my history of anxiety and will be written off as psychosomatic or as a result of my anxiety. I get anxious that they will brush things off and give me the standard lines about relaxing more, destressing, etc. I also feel anxious that they will think I'm crazy.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I woke up in the middle of the night with an extremely sore throat and swollen glands. It is unusual for me to be woken up in the middle of the night by anything, so I was concerned and went to get a glass of water. It hurt to swallow, so I decided to see what my throat looked like. When I found that there were white spots on the back of my throat, I knew that it could be strep throat and went in to the doctor. The test came back positive for strep throat.
